I see in the description that it does actually state that, but while I was debating size and color etc, I did not read the full details on the one I picked. Shame on me, but you should be aware. While this should be adequate for a single float, who are you going to put on this double one??? We are not that big. By my calculations, that would either be fine for 2 small women, your kids or a MAXIMUM 150lb man with a women 100lbs or less. Well... like I said, we are not that big, but 150lbs for a guy is pretty small and most women weigh over 100lbs. So unless you are a very small couple of any sex, you might want to reconsider this as a 2 person float. Maybe it would be good for a single 250lb person who needs the width, but I know, this was not what I was looking for. I will take it with us for this trip and report back, if for some reason it was great for more than that weight limit. I have my doubts. You have been warned.  - I am giving it one star, not for any other reason, than selling a 2 person float with a 250lb weight limit is as dumb as saying a small package of food has 72 servings at 15 calories each.  Garbage.

review_content: Love this thing. Took it in the ocean, laid back on it and bounced up and down in the waves. Never toppled over and they were good sized, fairly rough waves. This thing is so fun, my favorite Amazon purchase.Update, Jan 2020:Took it to the ocean with me during 2019, the second season I had it, Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester, MA. There's a river that rolls along near the shore then out to the open water, a lot of beach-goers float along in this river out to the ocean instead of going straight into the ocean (you can do either one at GH). I jumped in the river with my floatie, laid across the netting with the "airbags" on my right and left sides and was merrily kicking my way to the ocean until some 17 year old life guard started yelling at me. He told me those kinds of floatie devices aren't allowed there and directed me to bring it out of the water. I asked why and first he said 'I don't know' and then he said safety issues. I was disgusted. I had to slosh out of the water and leave it onshore then go in the ocean.Yes, this is relevent to my review. I realized the problem is those gigantic floatie things shaped like a piece of pizza or watermelon or a huge swan, etc, that people have been floating away on. They drift a few days out to deep sea they realize it and have to be rescued by Captain America.  So now Good Harbor Beach is classifying this floatie the same as those monstrous floaties and banning them. It might be the same at ocean beaches across the US. And the Great Lakes.So, maybe check with the beach you plan to go to beforehand and see if they'll allow a floatie like this one. They might not. The water wasn't nearly as fun without my floatie. I'll have to drop a note to the Good Harbor Beach council and see if they'll reconsider their stance bcz this is not like those crazy big floatie things, that are kind of like an air mattress, where you lose all sense of what's going on and float off to China.
